intro: Solena gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Solena gracilis is typically herbaceous, growing as an annual or perennial depending on the climate.
